turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Literary realism.
turn.1: What influence did George Gissing have on literary realism?
turn.2: While George Gissing (1857–1903), author of "New Grub Street" (1891), amongst many other works, has traditionally been viewed as a naturalist, mainly influenced by Émile Zola, Jacob Korg has suggested that George Eliot was a greater influence.
turn.4: Other novelists, such as Arnold Bennett (1867–1931) and Anglo-Irishman George Moore (1852–1933), consciously imitated the French realists.
turn.5: what were some of their famous works?
turn.6: Bennett's most famous works are the "Clayhanger" trilogy (1910–18) and "The Old Wives' Tale" (1908).
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: These books draw on his experience of life in the Staffordshire Potteries, an industrial area encompassing the six towns that now make up Stoke-on-Trent in Staffordshire, England.
turn.9: what was the name of some of Moore's famous works?
turn.10: George Moore, whose most famous work is "Esther Waters" (1894), was also influenced by the naturalism of Zola.
turn.12: William Dean Howells (1837–1920) was the first American author to bring a realist aesthetic to the literature of the United States.
